Package org.firstinspires.ftc.teamcode.pedroPathing.localization

Class PoseUpdater

java.lang.Object
org.firstinspires.ftc.teamcode.pedroPathing.localization.PoseUpdater
public class PoseUpdater extends Object
This is the PoseUpdater class. This class handles getting pose data from the localizer and returning the information in a useful way to the Follower.

    Creates a new PoseUpdater from a HardwareMap and a Localizer.

  • Method Details

    • update

      public void update()
      This updates the robot's pose, as well as updating the previous pose, velocity, and acceleration. The cache for the current pose, velocity, and acceleration is cleared, and the time stamps are updated as well.

    • setStartingPose

      public void setStartingPose(Pose set)
      This sets the starting pose. Do not run this after moving at all.
      Parameters:
      set - the Pose to set the starting pose to.

    • setCurrentPoseWithOffset

      public void setCurrentPoseWithOffset(Pose set)
      This sets the current pose, using offsets. Think of using offsets as setting trim in an aircraft. This can be reset as well, so beware of using the resetOffset() method.
      Parameters:
      set - The pose to set the current pose to.

    • setXOffset

      public void setXOffset(double offset)
      This sets the offset for only the x position.
      Parameters:
      offset - This sets the offset.

    • setYOffset

      public void setYOffset(double offset)
      This sets the offset for only the y position.
      Parameters:
      offset - This sets the offset.

    • setHeadingOffset

      public void setHeadingOffset(double offset)
      This sets the offset for only the heading.
      Parameters:
      offset - This sets the offset.

    • getXOffset

      public double getXOffset()
      This returns the x offset.
      Returns:
      returns the x offset.

    • getYOffset

      public double getYOffset()
      This returns the y offset.
      Returns:
      returns the y offset.

    • getHeadingOffset

      public double getHeadingOffset()
      This returns the heading offset.
      Returns:
      returns the heading offset.

    • applyOffset

      public Pose applyOffset(Pose pose)
      This applies the offset to a specified Pose.
      Parameters:
      pose - The pose to be offset.
      Returns:
      This returns a new Pose with the offset applied.

    • resetOffset

      public void resetOffset()
      This resets all offsets set to the PoseUpdater. If you have reset your pose using the setCurrentPoseUsingOffset(Pose2d set) method, then your pose will be returned to what the PoseUpdater thinks your pose would be, not the pose you reset to.

    • getPose

      public Pose getPose()
      This returns the current pose, with offsets applied. If this is called multiple times in a single update, the current pose is cached so that subsequent calls don't have to repeat localizer calls or calculations.
      Returns:
      returns the current pose.

    • getRawPose

      public Pose getRawPose()
      This returns the current raw pose, without any offsets applied. If this is called multiple times in a single update, the current pose is cached so that subsequent calls don't have to repeat localizer calls or calculations.
      Returns:
      returns the raw pose.

    • setPose

      public void setPose(Pose set)
      This sets the current pose without using resettable offsets.
      Parameters:
      set - the pose to set the current pose to.

    • getPreviousPose

      public Pose getPreviousPose()
      Returns the robot's pose from the previous update.
      Returns:
      returns the robot's previous pose.

    • getDeltaPose

      public Pose getDeltaPose()
      Returns the robot's change in pose from the previous update.
      Returns:
      returns the robot's delta pose.

    • getVelocity

      public Vector getVelocity()
      This returns the velocity of the robot as a Vector. If this is called multiple times in a single update, the velocity Vector is cached so that subsequent calls don't have to repeat localizer calls or calculations.
      Returns:
      returns the velocity of the robot.

    • getAngularVelocity

      public double getAngularVelocity()
      This returns the angular velocity of the robot as a double.
      Returns:
      returns the angular velocity of the robot.

    • getAcceleration

      public Vector getAcceleration()
      This returns the acceleration of the robot as a Vector. If this is called multiple times in a single update, the acceleration Vector is cached so that subsequent calls don't have to repeat localizer calls or calculations.
      Returns:
      returns the acceleration of the robot.

    • resetHeadingToIMU

      public void resetHeadingToIMU()
      This resets the heading of the robot to the IMU's heading, using Road Runner's pose reset.

    • resetHeadingToIMUWithOffsets

      public void resetHeadingToIMUWithOffsets()
      This resets the heading of the robot to the IMU's heading, using offsets instead of Road Runner's pose reset. This way, it's faster, but this can be wiped with the resetOffsets() method.

    • getNormalizedIMUHeading

      public double getNormalizedIMUHeading()
      This returns the IMU heading normalized to be between [0, 2 PI] radians.
      Returns:
      returns the normalized IMU heading.

    • getTotalHeading

      public double getTotalHeading()
      This returns the total number of radians the robot has turned.
      Returns:
      the total heading.

    • getLocalizer

      public Localizer getLocalizer()
      This returns the Localizer.
      Returns:
      the Localizer

    • resetIMU

      public void resetIMU()
